_comment: Created by ianb on 27/06/2014 16:21:55 using v2.1
title: How many days in total are patients delayed and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary: The total number of days that patients are delayed also fluctuates month by month. There has been a slight increase in the number of days patients are delayed. There was a total of 109,918 delayed days in August 2010, compared to a total of 116,471 delayed days in April 2014. Given that there have been fewer patients being delayed, we assume that there is an increase in the average length of delays â€“ though fewer people are waiting they are waiting longer.
data_source: NHS England, Delayed transfer of care
